title: Drawing, "Elevation of the Teatro Vaccai, Tolentino", 1790
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink across the lower margin of elevation: PERMISSU. AUSPICIOQUE. PHILIPPI. CARDINALIS. CARANDINI. OPTIMI. REGIMINIS. PRAEFECTI. / HONESTO. POPULI. OBLECTAMENTO.  THEATRUM. AERE. PUBLICO. ECITATUM. EST. ANNO. MDCCXC
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a therater.  Elevation of the main facade of a portico with three arched doorways.  The central doorway is decorated with coats of arms (of the cardinal of the town).  The main body of the theater is visible behind the portico.  It includes a semi-circular space, directly behind the portico.  Inscription below the elevation.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Elevation of the Teatro Vaccai, Tolentino", 1790.
1790. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3739.
